1.text: Become, then, followers of God, as children beloved,

2.text: and walk in love, as also the Christ did love us, and did give himself for us, an offering and a sacrifice to God for an odour of a sweet smell,

3.text: and whoredom, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not even be named among you, as becometh saints;

4.text: also filthiness, and foolish talking, or jesting,—the things not fit—but rather thanksgiving;

5.text: for this ye know, that every whoremonger, or unclean, or covetous person, who is an idolater, hath no inheritance in the reign of the Christ and God.

6.text: Let no one deceive you with vain words, for because of these things cometh the anger of God upon the sons of the disobedience,

7.text: become not, then, partakers with them,

8.text: for ye were once darkness, and now light in the Lord; as children of light walk ye,

9.text: for the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness, and righteousness, and truth,

10.text: proving what is well-pleasing to the Lord,

11.text: and have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of the darkness and rather even convict,

12.text: for the things in secret done by them it is a shame even to speak of,

13.text: and all the things reproved by the light are manifested, for everything that is manifested is light;

14.text: wherefore he saith, ‘Arouse thyself, thou who art sleeping, and arise out of the dead, and the Christ shall shine upon thee.’

15.text: See, then, how exactly ye walk, not as unwise, but as wise,

16.text: redeeming the time, because the days are evil;

17.text: because of this become not fools, but—understanding what is the will of the Lord,

18.text: and be not drunk with wine, in which is dissoluteness, but be filled in the Spirit,

19.text: speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord,

20.text: giving thanks always for all things, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to the God and Father;

21.text: subjecting yourselves to one another in the fear of God.

22.text: The wives! to your own husbands subject yourselves, as to the Lord,

23.text: because the husband is head of the wife, as also the Christ is head of the assembly, and he is saviour of the body,

24.text: but even as the assembly is subject to Christ, so also are the wives to their own husbands in everything.

25.text: The husbands! love your own wives, as also the Christ did love the assembly, and did give himself for it,

26.text: that he might sanctify it, having cleansed it with the bathing of the water in the saying,

27.text: that he might present it to himself the assembly in glory, not having spot or wrinkle, or any of such things, but that it may be holy and unblemished;

28.text: so ought the husbands to love their own wives as their own bodies: he who is loving his own wife—himself he doth love;

29.text: for no one ever his own flesh did hate, but doth nourish and cherish it, as also the Lord—the assembly,

30.text: because members we are of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones;

31.text: ‘for this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined to his wife, and they shall be—the two—for one flesh;’

32.text: this secret is great, and I speak in regard to Christ and to the assembly;

33.text: but ye also, every one in particular—let each his own wife so love as himself, and the wife—that she may reverence the husband.
